pullRequest.body:
Rename measurable spaces \alpha and \beta to X and Y.
Rename variables a : X and b : Y to x and y, respectively (and associated hypotheses as well).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Could you please explain why you consider this change to be beneficial?

Sure! In short, as I understand it, using Greek letters dates back to 2017, but often differs from modern conventions.
(For topological spaces, this was explicitly confirmed on zulip; I have renamed a fair number of such types.)

For this file, many instances of \alpha are in fact topological spaces. As such, I think \alpha is a bad name (and X more standard).
I would think the same holds for measurable spaces; I'm open to switching to a different name (such as $\Omega$)!

I'd be happy to approve this if you can stamp out the last few inconsistencies. In particular the measurable spaces called `Î²` should become `Y`, and there are quite a few places where you have renamed `Î±` to `X` but a generic element of this type is still denoted `a`, so we should change `a : Î±` to `x : X`.  (I apologise for being pedantic here, but there's no point in doing notation-change PR's at all unless it's done carefully: a slightly unfamiliar, but consistent, convention is still far better than an inconsistent mixture.)
awaiting-review

Thanks for the careful look! I agree with all your comments.
I've gone over the entire file again and also tried to rename every single variable. Let me know if I missed one :-)

In `SetIndicatorConstLp` and `integral_indicatorConstLp`: rename `a` to `x` (and rename `x` to something else in the latter)

In `integrableOn_iUnion_of_summable_integral_norm` and around: indexing set shouldn't be `Y` (maybe iota?)

That's all I spotted. Thanks for fixing this!

Well spotted! (I had wondered about the former, but not seen the latter.) Changed now.
awaiting-review
What's going on with the argument order in your last commit? I'm puzzled how changing the names of variables can make them reorder themselves!

Along with renaming the variable, there's an implicit change which variable is being re-used.
Previously, Y was being re-used (which was declared at the beginning, on line 61); now, I'm using a new type \iota (which is declared on line 814). This causes the order change.

I just tweaked the variables on line 814 (putting iota first), but that's all I can do - short of putting \iota on line 61 also.

The change to variable order isn't a problem per se, I just wanted to check that it wasn't an indication of some unintentional code change. I'm labelling this as "awaiting CI" and if it passes then I'll flag it for a maintainer merge.
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8157658927/job/22297833633)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8157658927/job/22297833919)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8157658927/job/22297833360)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
This lemma now involves two measurable spaces of which one is called `X` and the other `Î²`.
I'm happy to rename \beta to Y also, if that's desired.
We definitely want the naming be consistent, so either both names should change or neither.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(MeasureTheory/Integral/SetIntegral): rename type variables

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: continuity of the parametric set integral
